page.title: 10THE PRIORY,EARLS COLNE
page.content: Many references have been made to the{ {Priory}as both a monastry and a manor house. The house which aquired the same name was built alongside the monastry soon after the dissolution of 1536. The Tudor manor house, faced west with a walled courtyard at the front; farm buildings and two lakes to the south; and an enclosed orchard, complete with dove house, to the north. The perimeter wall, with its three gateways, seems to have extended the full length of the couseway, to the point where it makes a left turn towards the church. When the house was rebuilt,in 1750, all but a tiny fragment was destroyed. The building is no longer used as a{ {Priory}, but as an attractive private house where Mr. and Mrs Jordon live.
